greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows in which row n lists 2n-1 terms: n, in the center of the row and the pairs of prime numbers that are equidistant to n, with 0's inserted, as shown below in the example.
link: Nathaniel Johnston, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
maple: for n from 1 to 10 do for k from 1 to 2*n-1 do if(k=n or (isprime(k) and isprime(2*n-k)))then print(k):else print(0):fi:od:od: # _Nathaniel Johnston_, Apr 18 2011
results.author: _Omar E. Pol_, Jan 14 2009
